caption: I normally always go here two times a week for alil dirty fruit drink... And it's great!!! You should try it, as of right now it's my lil secret...

I had THE most incredible evening here filled with amazing food, fantastic service, and lots of laughter. The atmosphere is fun and fresh— and may I say the wait staff knows their stuff. Our waiter, Scott, kept our table on their toes and was full of suggestions and jokes. Alongside the team of manager, Nicole, and chefs, Bun and Paul, we had an out of this world experience and a night to remember! I will definitely be back, and it is worth the stop in the big apple!

I am an amateur Italian chef and I try to get only the best ingredients for my pasta dishes. The seafood at Essex pearl is simply amazing. My fav are lobsters and langoustines. I made the most epic tagliatelle ever . And the team there is amazing, great customer service and we keep in contact on ig sharing recipes and plates. today I was running late from work and they saved me a order even after work hours. Who does that in the city?! Essex pearl is my seafood fam, not just a market / restaurant. Ditch any other seafood places and go there.

This is a good place to gorge on seafood that is not ridiculously expensive and where the seafood is very fresh because they don't buy from middleman. I especially loved the selection of oysters we had. The waiter was very well versed on the different ones they had to offer. I like the sauces that came with them especially the pickle ice. The standout dishes were the shrimp fritters and the lobster. Some of the prepared foods were  under seasoned like the monkfish skewers.
Amazing food - had lobster Bao, banana leaf dorado, water spinach and shrimp fritters. All must haves!

Saw that this place was new on my maps so I decided to check it out for a quick appetizer before heading to dinner with friends. Wow what great service! For a huge space with other food vendors this pot pays attention to details and has some really fresh seafood. Our waiter really helped me with my order with his suggestions and I feel like their oysters are a steal deal. $2 east coast oysters taste way better then the $4 west coast oysters. PS $1 oysters during happy hour. Wish I could have ate from the dinner menu because they had some good fusion options. Thai, middle eastern, and east coast classics that’s what type of dishes you’ll see on there menu.

Some of the most interesting, amazing seafood I have ever had. Many of the dishes are served with an asian flair, but there are also the American classics like Maine lobster rolls. People from New England shouldn't miss out on the 1/2 lobster, because I know you guys get good ones up there, but I guarantee you've never had it made like this! This is the type of place I want to take my visitors in New York. Not overhyped as yet, but incredible. Really a hidden gem. Pro tip: One of the managers is a Sommelier and curates an excellent wine list. She's more than happy to speak about it with guests if you ask. The waiter gentleman with glasses is also very knowledgeable about wines.  Great place for a date, especially if you're going to a movie upstairs later. Food arrives quick.

made my first visit here last night on date night with my girlfriend. they offer a $1 oyster happy hour from 5-7pm monday-friday. the happy hour menu also includes a $4 narragansett beer and a cheap white wine. loved the space and will definitely be back here for dinner.

Wow!  We had a fantastic dinner from start to finish. New year’s resolution is to return. I apologize for the length of this review but thought the details are worth sharing. The dining starts with great suggestions and insights on the wine selection.  Several wines were suggested that would pair well with the seafood we were about to order.  It was great to have detailed knowledge of the origins of the wine as we considered our many choices.  We ended up with a great Greek wine which was perfect for the raw seafood tower. Oysters were beautiful and reasonably priced. I highly recommend the creative frozen Pickling gratinee to accompany. The stone crabs were every bit as good as those we get in Miami and better than any we find in Washington. Great aioli dip and I appreciated the medicine drop hot sauce table side to add a kick. Loved the urchins which our server helpfully explained were from Maine and therefore different from west coast ones we’re familiar with. Large shrimp were fresh and delectable. Every dish that followed we superb. The HamachI was spectacular.  Lobster Bao is a must try and had a nice spicy hit. Shrimp fritters were amazing. We tried two fish dishes-the whole branzino and the Fluke. Both were very different preparations and showed off the freshness of the fish and creativity and skills of the chef. Speaking of the chef we had the pleasure to meet him. His range of tastes and the combinations he creates are amazing. Every dish sung. We were a table of 9 and everyone commented on how amazing the range of tastes we experienced were and how consistently well prepared was each dish. Get the biscuits!  Try to octopus tin. Even the fingerlings are special with a nice salt finish. Other sides are excellent as well.  Though seafood is the story don’t miss the pork chop. Locally sourced, cooked perfectly and sliced for serving,  it is delicious. And be sure to enjoy the bone if you’re so lucky as to nab it. If you could not tell, we loved this meal and this restaurant. Service was exceptional. And arrive a bit early to enjoy the surroundings. The Essex market is worth the visit alone. So many food shops and variety of offerings. Window shop to get your appetite ready for one great meal at Essex Pearl!

Not to be missed at the foot of the big staircase this place has a seafood market, a to-go counter, and a restaurant, the last of which this review is focused on. Naturally the draw is going to be the raw bar with a great selection of fresh oysters, sea urchins, scallops, and crab but the full menu has some really delicious plates. The standouts for me were the conch ceviche, lobster bao, and the black butter branzino. All tasted fresh and flavorful. The service was attentive but not intrusive. The other thing not to overlook here is the wine selection, great diversity while having all the classics represented. Looking forward to dining here again!

I had such high hopes for this seafood restaurant in the new Essex Market. based on the happy hour it was a bit of a letdown. Oysters were good but accompanying sauces were underwhelming. They don’t have their act together yet but will give this another shot in a few weeks.

They serve a dollar oyster happy hour from 4 to 6 here. Last visit I had oysters from Washington State, PEI, and Massachusetts for a buck. None of them were the standard blue points  for a dollar. They have a very nice seafood market here as well you can take lobster, scallops, rock crab claws, etc home with your at market prices.I had a muscadet wine here that was served in a 40 oz bottle. It was surprisingly good and paid well with the oysters.

My wife and I live locally in the neighborhood and have been excited about Essex Market (where Essex Pearl is) for years now!  When walking down the main staircase this restaurant takes up your whole view and seems as if it is 80% of the entire Market!  We stopped by on opening night and had the oysters because the kitchen was opening the following weekend.  My wife and I are not very food savvy, but Essex Pearl took care of that with detailed information, tasting recommendations, first class service, and of course most importantly DELICIOUS FOOD.  We went back the following week on date night and tried the main kitchen and were extremely impressed.  The Front House Manager Nicole was awesome and gave us an amazing wine choice, recommended plates (Shrimp Fritters and Hamachi Appetizer are AMAZING!), and again the full service was AWESOME.  Highly recommended, A+++++

I’ve never been to a restaurant that has impressed me to this degree. From the excellent customer service to the exquisite food, every plate will have you wowed. The mastery that goes into every plate is just impeccable. My personal favorites were the shrimp fritters and the conch ceviche but you can order anything on the menu and you can’t go wrong. Don’t miss out on this place!

OMG!  The freshest, most delicious oysters ever.  Great wine selection and excellent service. All a great compliment to the market. Can't wait to go back to try more of the impressive menu.  Congrats to Chef Bun.
I am also a regular customer of their other seafood market Aqua Best on Grand Street. Family oriented, the seafood is ALWAYS fresh and they know me for always purchasing their fresh blue crabs!
Great service and great food, had a wonderful dinner. You know the seafood will be extra fresh with a fish market in front!! Mahi-mahi was cooked so perfectly!
